instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3071: What is 820-3071? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-3332: What is 820-3332? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.AVREF_SMC: What is AVREF_SMC? AVREF_SMC is a reference voltage provided to the SMC so that its sensors have a reference to work from, this should be 3.3v.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3071</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turn off
threads.message: hello this board It turns off after a while of using it, how do I determine that it is indeed video damage?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3071</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turn off
threads.message: Run GPU a stress test (Unigine Heaven/Valley, for example) and see if crashes immediatelly.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3071</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turn off
threads.message: ok,  the computer is only turn on in bypass mode, do you think it is due to the gpu

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3071</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turn off
threads.message: Then you have a problem with some SMC sensor; check VSENSE and ISENSE outputs.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3071</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turn off
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3071</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turn off
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3071</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turn off
threads.message:
Machine turns on in SMC bypass mode and loads macOS?
If yes, run HWMonitor and post the screenshot.

Check <SIGNAL>SMC_DCIN</SIGNAL>/<SIGNAL>PBUS_VSENSE</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>SMC_DCIN</SIGNAL>/<SIGNAL>CHGR_BMON_ISENSE</SIGNAL>.
Be sure to have correct resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28 of <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3071</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turn off
threads.message:
Check <SIGNAL>SMC_DCIN</SIGNAL>/<SIGNAL>PBUS_VSENSE</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>SMC_DCIN</SIGNAL>/<SIGNAL>CHGR_BMON_ISENSE</SIGNAL>.All 0v, its normal? the computer must be turned on SMC bypass
<SIGNAL>SMC_DCIN</SIGNAL>=2.3
<SIGNAL>PBUS_VSENSE</SIGNAL>=1.4v
<SIGNAL>CHGR_BMON_ISENSE</SIGNAL>=0v
resistance pin 17/18 and 27/28 is good.Yes load macos, but they only load some 2 items HW MONITOR, I've tried adding other files but it's still the same.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3071</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turn off
threads.message: Possibly bad solders under SMC; reball it.
